content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am looking for information regarding driving offences in your area.
Specifically, I would like a breakdown of all driving offence fines given out in 2023 and so far in 2024, including:
- a list of the offences committed in 2023 and to date in 2024 (separated per year)
- a list of the fines associated with each offence
- total amount collected in fines in 2023 and to date in 2024 (separated per year)
- total number of offences in 2023 and to date in 2024 (up until records allow) (separated per year)
I would like to receive this preferably in Excel format.
Yours faithfully,
Jade Tilbury

Dear Jade Tilbury,
Thank you for your request for information relating to driving offences
which we received on 26/09/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 24/10/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail
References
Visible links
1. mailto:[Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear Jade Tilbury,
Thank you for your request for information relating to driving offences
which we received on 26/09/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can begin to process your FOI Request, we would like to clarify
what information you require.
Please tell us what you mean by driving offences. We interpret “driving”
to mean the vehicle is moving. There are parking contraventions and bus
lane/Clean Air Zone contraventions. Does your request cover both?
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to a
request within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the
day after we receive the necessary clarification.
You can provide your clarification by replying to this email. Please
note, if clarification is not received within 2 months your Freedom of
Information request will be closed.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
